description.narrative: 5.3 Improved capacity of schools and other learning facilities at primary level to provide child friendly learning environment to children (boys and girls) by the end of December 2019., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 5.0 Improved learning outcomes and equitable and inclusive education for all boys and girls by 2018

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.3 Improved capacity of schools and other learning facilities at primary level to provide child friendly learning environment tochildren (boys and girls) by the end of December 2019.

description.narrative: To accommodate the 34 percent increase in enrolment in 2019, the number of government approved schools doubled. 1,120 head-teachers (28 per cent female; cumulative total of 13,410 in the current Country Programme) in 10 districts participated in UNICEF supported training, which aimed to strengthen teachers' pedagogical skills for quality teaching and participatory classroom practices, improving the capacity of schools to provide child friendly learning environments. To promote conducive and child friendly learning environments, UNICEF oversaw the provision of learning materials benefitting 342,012 students, (50% girls) in 1,663 primary schools and teaching materials to 3,712 teachers. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
